lyrics: i dont want it<c> and i dont want to want you<c> but in my dreams, i seem to be more honest<c> and i must admit youve been in quite a few<c> halleys comet<c> comes around more than i do<c> but youre all it takes for me to break a promise<c> silly me to fall in love with you<c> i havent slept since sunday<c> midnight for me is 3am for you<c> but my sleepless nights are better<c> with you than nights could ever be alone, oohooh<c> i was good at feeling nothin, now im hopeless<c> what a drag to love you like i do<c> oohoohoohoohooh<c> ive been loved before, but right now, in this moment<c> i feel more and more like i was mad for you<c> for you<c> im sitting in my brothers room<c> havent slept in a week or two, or two<c> i think i might hav fallen in love<c> what am i to do?

title: when i was older
lyrics: when i was older<c> i was a sailor on an open sea<c> but now im underwater<c> and my skin is paler than it should ever be<c> hmm<c> im on my back again<c> dreaming of a time and place<c> where you and i remain the best of friends<c> even after all this ends<c> can we pretend?<c> im on my, im on my back again<c> its seeming more and more<c> like all we ever do is see how far it bends<c> before it breaks in half and then<c> we bend it back again<c> guess i got caught in the middle of it<c> yes ive been taught, got a little of it<c> in my blood, in my blood<c> memories burn like a forest fire<c> heavy rain turns any funeral pyre to mud<c> in the flood<c> when i was older<c> i was a sailor on an open sea<c> but now im underwater<c> and my skin is paler than it should ever be<c> im watching movies back to back in black and white, i never<c> seen anybody do it like i do it any better<c> been goin over you, im overdue for new endeavors<c> nobody lonely like im lonely and i dont know whether<c> youd really like it in the limelight<c> youd sympathize with all the bad guys<c> im still a victim in my own right<c> but im the villain in my own eyes, yeah<c> when i was older<c> i was a sailor on an open sea

title: i didnt change my number

title: not my responsibility
lyrics: do you know me?<c> really know me?<c> you have opinions about my opinions<c> about my music<c> about my clothes<c> aboutmybody<c> some people hatewhat i wear<c> some people praise it<c> somepeople use it to shame others<c> some people use it toshameme<c> buti feel youwatching<c> always<c> and nothing ido goes unseen<c> so while i feel your stares, your disapproval or your sigh of relief<c> if i lived by them, id never be able to move<c> would you like me to be smaller, weaker, softer, taller?<c> would you like me to be quiet?<c> do my shoulders provoke you? does my chest?<c> am i my stomach? my hips?<c> the body i was born with<c> is it not what you wanted?<c> if i wear what is comfortable, i am not a woman<c> if i shed the layers, im a slut<c> though youve never seen my body, you still judge it<c> and judge me for it<c> why?<c> we make assumptions about people based on their size<c> we decide who they are<c> we decide what theyre worth<c> if i wear more, if i wear less<c> who decides what that makes me? what that means?<c> is my value based only on your perception?<c> or is your opinion of me not my responsibility?

title: everybody dies
lyrics: everybody dies, surprise, surprise<c> we tell each other lies, sometimes, we try<c> to make it feel like we might be right<c> we might not be alone<c> be alone<c> everybody dies, thats what they say<c> and maybe, in a couple hundred years, theyll find another way<c> i just wonder why youd wanna stay<c> if everybody goes<c> youd still be alone<c> i dont wanna cry, some days i do<c> but not about you<c> its just a lot to think about the world im used to<c> the one i cant get back, at last not for a while<c> i sure have a knack for seein lif more like a child<c> its not my fault, its not so wrong to wonder why<c> everybody dies<c> and when will i?<c> you oughta know<c> that even when its time, you might not wanna go<c> but its okay to cry and its alright to fold<c> but you are not alone<c> you are not unknown
